remarks: If ` X ` is a set with an ` R ` successor in ` A ` , then its well-founded successor is a member of ` A ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 15-Jun-2018.)
statement:
wsuccl.1 $e |- ( ph -> R We A ) $.
wsuccl.2 $e |- ( ph -> R Se A ) $.
wsuccl.3 $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
wsuccl.4 $e |- ( ph -> E. y e. A X R y ) $.
wsuccl $p |- ( ph -> wsuc ( R , A , X ) e. A ) $.
$d A y $.
$d R y $.
$d X y $.
